page.title: 17GAMES CHILDREN PLAY
page.content: Bulldog. A chasing game. Some children stand at one end of the playground or field and try to run to the other without being touched by the person who is "it".("It" is the person who is trying to catch the other children.) The best way of deciding who shall be "it" is to say the rhyme; "One potato, two potato, three potato, four. Five potato, six potato, seven potato, more. One is bad!" The person indicated on the word "bad!" is "it". If you are touched by "it" you then have to help him or her to catch everybody else until everyone is caught. The game then restarts with the person who was first caught being "it". Tig. A chasing game. One person who is "it" tries to touch another person who
